intro: Conyza tunariensis, commonly known as the Andean ironweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white. Conyza tunariensis is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
